item.title: Staff Writer, Women’s Basketball (Remote)
item.description:
About Us
The Athletic is a digital sports media company that brings true sports fans closer to the athletes, teams and leagues that captivate their attention. We serve a multi-faceted audience that craves a richer connection and understanding with immersive storytelling and a like-minded community of fans. Founded in 2016 and with major operational hubs in San Francisco, Los Angeles, London and Melbourne, we empower a truly global team of more than 600 creators and cover more than 250 professional sports and collegiate teams across the United States, Canada and the UK. Our newsroom has produced thousands of in-depth reports along with more than 120 podcasts and other forms of premium content. Put simply, The Athletic is at the center of a sports fan’s universe.
About the Role
The Athletic is looking for an energetic, motivated writer who is interested in telling unique and differentiating stories to an audience that appreciates quality above all else. This job is for someone who wants to be the authority on women’s basketball – college basketball and the WNBA – from breaking news to in-depth storytelling.

Our newsroom has produced thousands of in-depth reports along with more than 120 podcasts and other forms of premium content. Put simply, The Athletic is at the center of a sports fan’s universe.
About the Role
For the company's first 5 years, our subscriber growth engine has been powered by a small but effective growth team. Our business has now grown to the point where we've expanded our Growth team into 2 distinct teams (Acquisition, and Retention).
Our Acquisition team is focused on growing our subscriber base and revenue through rapid experimentation - both key metrics that power our subscription business. The team is responsible for a significant part of the product including subscription growth funnels, pricing, payments, and referrals.
Our Retention team also works on core subscription business metrics: reducing churn and retaining subscribers over time. This team will drive longer-term strategic changes to the core subscription provisioning infrastructure to set us up for the next phase of growth including payments infrastructure, winbacks, cancellation, and other touchpoints further along the lifecycle of users and subscribers.
As a full-stack engineer, you'll get to work on every part of the stack: web, backend, API, database, analytics.

item.title: Editor, Standards
item.description:
About Us

Our newsroom has produced thousands of in-depth reports along with more than 120 podcasts and other forms of premium content. Put simply, The Athletic is at the center of a sports fan’s universe.
About the Role
The Standards Editor is a leadership role in the newsroom to help safeguard our journalistic standards and maintain readers’ trust at a crucial juncture for The Athletic.
The editor will set and update the editorial standards for the company, support the staff to ensure the right processes are in place to preserve the integrity of our work, and conduct training and review sessions around our guidelines. The editor will also work through sensitive stories and other content before publication for fairness and other standards issues, as well as answer queries and advise colleagues on ethics issues. In addition, the editor will take the lead in an array of responsibilities, including:
-- Safeguarding our standards on social media (both institutional and individual accounts), operating with the authority to make judgment calls when our standards are not met -- Monitoring content and advising colleagues in all areas in which we publish content, including video, audio, newsletters and other less traditional forms -- Training programs focused on standards -- Broadening our efforts to monitor and respond to reader concerns -- Updating and maintaining our community guidelines -- Updating our formal ethics and style guidelines
The editor should be an experienced journalist with the judgment and credibility to weigh in on difficult issues and get the right response from desk editors. Essential qualities include rock-solid judgment, strong editing skills and a deep understanding of The Athletic’s ethics and standards.
